sentence: So the warehouse cat was named the German, or “Boche,” and the attic cat the Englishman, or “Tommy.” Sometime after that they got rid of Tommy, but Boche is always there to amuse us when we go downstairs.
The warehouse cat was always the aggressor, while the attic cat was ultimately the victor, just as in politics.
Extra butter for the youngsters, the problems facing today’s youth—you name it, and Mother defends the younger generation.
She’s the warehouse and office cat, who keeps the rats at bay in the storeroom.
A pair of straw thongs that were purchased for 6.50 guilders were worn down to the soles within a week.
This family saga is extremely well written, but the parts dealing with war, writers and the emancipation of women aren’t very good.
For a while the firm Gies & Co. had two cats: one for the warehouse and one for the attic.
